intro: Lippia ekmanii, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, gray-green leaves and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny environments such as grasslands and rocky soils. Lippia ekmanii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. Its compact size and ornamental value make it a popular choice for garden use in warm climates.
